contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox city Japan |Name = Hōhoku |official_name = Hōhoku-chō |JapaneseName = 豊北町 |settlement_type = Town |ImageSkyline = |ImageSize = |ImageCaption = |MapImage = |Region = [[Chūgoku region|Chūgoku]], [[San'yō region|San'yō]], [[San'in region|San'in]] |Prefecture = [[Yamaguchi Prefecture]] |District = [[Toyoura District, Yamaguchi|Toyoura]] ([[List of dissolved districts of Japan|dissolved]]) |Area_km2 = 168.61 |PopDate = 2005 |Population = 12740 |Density_km2 = 75.56 |LatitudeDegrees = |LatitudeMinutes = |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = |LongtitudeMinutes = |LongtitudeSeconds = |Tree = [[Camellia]] |Flower = [[Prunus serrulata|Hill Cherry]] |Flowering tree = |Bird = |Butterfly = |Fish = |Others = |SymbolImage = |SymbolDescription = |Mayor = |CityHallPostalCode = 759-5592 |CityHallAddress = 3140-1 Oaza Takibe, Hōhoku-chō, Shimonoseki-shi, Yamaguchi-ken |CityHallPhone = |CityHallLink = }} {{nihongo|'''Hōhoku'''|豊北町|Hōhoku-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Toyoura District, Yamaguchi|Toyoura District]], [[Yamaguchi Prefecture|Yamaguchi]], [[Japan]]. [[Image:Brunton lighthouse at Tsunoshima.jpg|thumb|right|The last of Brunton's 26 lighthouses at [[Tsunoshima|Tsunoshima island]], Hohoku, [[Shimonoseki]], [[Yamaguchi prefecture]]]] [[File:角島大橋１.jpg|thumb|Tsunoshima　Bridge]] On February 13 2005, Hōhoku, along with the towns of [[Kikugawa, Yamaguchi|Kikugawa]], [[Toyoura, Yamaguchi|Toyoura]] and [[Toyota, Yamaguchi|Toyota]], all from [[Toyoura District, Yamaguchi|Toyoura District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Shimonoseki, Yamaguchi|Shimonoseki]]. As of January 31 2005, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 12,740 and a [[population density|density]] of 75.56 persons per km². The total area is 168.61 km². == Famous Residents == * Masaaki Ikenaga: Former baseball player for the [[Saitama Seibu Lions]]. * SION: Singer-songwriter * Kikusha Tagami: Edo-period poet * Taiichi Nakayama: Founder of Nakayama Taiyoudou Cosmetics (now Club Cosmetics Co.,Ltd) * [[Kiyoshi Sasabe]]: Film director * Keiko Umeda: Announcer * [[Ryuji Fujita]]: Japanese Artist ==External links== * [http://lifeaccessory.net/ Life Accessory - A Guide To Hōhoku] {{ja icon}} * [http://www.city.shimonoseki.yamaguchi.jp/ Shimonoseki official website] {{ja icon}} * [http://www2.city.shimonoseki.yamaguchi.jp/icity/browser?ActionCode=content&ContentID=1133769587651&SiteID=0 Shimonoseki official website] {{en icon}} * [http://ww5.tiki.ne.jp/~houhoku-syo/ Shimonoseki Commerce and Industry Association - Hōhoku Branch] {{ja icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hohoku, Yamaguchi}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Yamaguchi Prefecture]] {{Yamaguchi-geo-stub}}
